result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan M Bautista IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:10 PM Defendant Juan M Bautista IV in court, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Juan M Bautista IV.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dolch states joint recommendation.  State agrees.  Chapter 950 has been complied with.  No VIS.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:

$453.00 fine or costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
30 Days in Sauk County Jail, consecutive to 22CM56 and to any others, with huber/work release, if available - FORTHWITH
EMP approved, subject to jail rules and availability
23 days jail credit
$50.96 Restitution with 15% Surcharge To:  (PAID THRU SAUK CO. CLERK OF COURTS), 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
Provide DNA Sample

Count 2:
